columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the cluster.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The unique identifier for the cluster.

columns.name: cluster_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.

columns.name: state
columns.description: The current state of the cluster.

columns.name: status
columns.description: The current status details about the cluster.

columns.name: auto_scaling_role
columns.description: An IAM role for automatic scaling policies.

columns.name: auto_terminate
columns.description: Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all steps.

columns.name: custom_ami_id
columns.description: Available only in Amazon EMR version 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.

columns.name: ebs_root_volume_size
columns.description: The size of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux AMI that is used for each EC2 instance, in GiB. Available in Amazon EMR version 4.x and later.

columns.name: instance_collection_type
columns.description: The instance group configuration of the cluster.

columns.name: log_encryption_kms_key_id
columns.description: The AWS KMS customer master key (CMK) used for encrypting log files. This attribute is only available with EMR version 5.30.0 and later, excluding EMR 6.0.0.

columns.name: log_uri
columns.description: The path to the Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are stored.

columns.name: outpost_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is launched.

columns.name: master_public_dns_name
columns.description: The DNS name of the master node.

columns.name: normalized_instance_hours
columns.description: An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours.

columns.name: release_label
columns.description: The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of open-source application packages installed on the cluster.

columns.name: repo_upgrade_on_boot
columns.description: Applies only when CustomAmiID is used. Specifies the type of updates that are applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories when an instance boots using the AMI.

columns.name: requested_ami_version
columns.description: Applies only when CustomAmiID is used. Specifies the type of updates that are applied from the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories when an instance boots using the AMI.

columns.name: running_ami_version
columns.description: The AMI version running on this cluster.

columns.name: scale_down_behavior
columns.description: The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.

columns.name: security_configuration
columns.description: The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.

columns.name: service_role
columns.description: The IAM role that will be assumed by the Amazon EMR service to access AWS resources on your behalf.

columns.name: step_concurrency_level
columns.description: Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently.

columns.name: termination_protected
columns.description: Indicates whether Amazon EMR will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2 instances from being terminated by an API call or user intervention, or in the event of a cluster error.

columns.name: visible_to_all_users
columns.description: Indicates whether the cluster is visible to all IAM users of the AWS account associated with the cluster.

columns.name: applications
columns.description: The applications installed on this cluster.

columns.name: configurations
columns.description: Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.

columns.name: ec2_instance_attributes
columns.description: Provides information about the EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by category.

columns.name: placement_groups
columns.description: Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.

columns.name: kerberos_attributes
columns.description: Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is enabled using a security configuration.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags associated with a cluster.
